ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is for the kafirun and cannot be averted
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which will inevitably seize the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: - Upon the disbelievers – the punishment that none can avert.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The unbelievers-- there is none to avert it--
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for the unbelievers, which none may avert,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Upon the disbelievers, which none can repel,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to those who deny the truth. No power can hinder God
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The infidels, of which there is no averter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —which none can avert from the faithless —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Unbelievers, the which there is none to ward off,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the unbelievers which none can prevent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: For the disbelievers; none can repel it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:2] — which in the case of the disbelievers none can avert: this was al-Nadr b. al-Hārith who said, ‘O God, if this be indeed the truth from You … [then rain down upon us stones from the heaven’ [Q. 8:32],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Upon the disbelievers) while he is himself a disbeliever, (which none can repel) and so he was killed in captivity on the Day of Badr,
